definition: that/that kind of/that sort of/that type of
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing

sentences.english: You’re probably one of those weirdos that doesn’t drink coffee in the morning either.
sentences.chinese: 而且你可能也是那种早晨不用喝咖啡的古怪人。

sentences.english: There'sno need for that kind of language in this magazine .
sentences.chinese: 这份杂志没必要出现那种语言。

sentences.english: Tom is an easygoing type of person who gets along well with everyone.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆是那种随和的人，跟谁都合得来。

sentences.english: Perhaps, this is the unbending youth from northeast of China.
sentences.chinese: 也许这就是一个北方大男孩的那种倔强吧？

sentences.english: But Anna combine not ashamed embarrassed, return just expose that kind of the color of the grudge.
sentences.chinese: 可是安娜并不羞窘，还只是露着那种怨恨之色。

sentences.english: "What are those good-smelling flowers with thorns called again?" he eventually asks.
sentences.chinese: 那种好闻又带刺的花儿叫什么名字来着？

sentences.english: That deceit won't pass with me.
So your car doesn't really need the higher octane.
sentences.chinese: 您没必要买那种含有辛烷的汽油。

sentences.english: I want some more of your dynamite stewed beef, please.
sentences.chinese: 请再给我一些你们那种美味可口的炖牛肉。

sentences.english: Sam could not supply (to purchase) the camera he longed for for it was too expensive.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆买不起他极想要那种照相机，因为那相机太贵了。

sentences.english: Suddenly the giddiness is gone, and I stare at the ground.
sentences.chinese: 突然那种恍惚不见了，我盯着地面。

sentences.english: 'My dear cousin,I don't eat that kind of food in my house.
sentences.chinese: 我的亲爱的堂兄弟，我在我的房子里不吃那种食品。

sentences.english: It was proved wrong to say things like that.
sentences.chinese: 已经证实那种讲法是差池的。

sentences.english: That swindle soured a great many potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 那种行骗行为令许多想去投资的人欲往而止。

sentences.english: The incidents are of a more external kind, but very funny.
sentences.chinese: 这些插曲属于非常表面化的那种，但是十分有趣。

sentences.english: The old-time thrill at receiving a publisher's check was gone.
sentences.chinese: 以前那种发表作品收到支票时的激动已经没有了。

definition: to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
this/this kind of/this sort of/this type of
to have guts/to have courage/to be brave

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
